title: Books: New and noteworthy
text:
'If Someone Says 'You Complete Me,' Run! by Whoopi Goldberg (Photo: Hachette)
CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE USA TODAY’s Jocelyn McClurg scopes out the hottest books on sale each week.
1 . If Someone Says “You Complete Me,” Run! Whoopi’s Big Book of Relationships by Whoopi Goldberg (Hachette, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 13)
What it’s about: The star offers her thoughts on what she’s learned in relationships, including this piece of advice: “Don’t talk with food in your mouth.”
The buzz: It’s a busy fall for Whoopi, between her new book, starring on TV’s The View and in the new movie Big Stone Gap .
2. Unfaithful Music & Disappearing Ink by Elvis Costello (Blue Rider Press, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 13)
What it’s about: A memoir by the English singer/songwriter who burst on the scene in the 1970s with My Aim Is True and remains musically active today.
The buzz: “Endearing …feels like a discussion between friends over a pint,” says Publishers Weekly .
'See Me' by Nicholas Sparks (Photo: Grand Central)
3. See Me by Nicholas Sparks (Grand Central, fiction, on sale Oct. 13)
What it’s about: In this thriller set in North Carolina, a young couple is threatened by demons from their pasts.
The buzz: Sparks is a best-selling (and movie-making machine): 11 of his books have been No. 1 USA TODAY best sellers.
4. Humans of New York: Stories by Brandon Stanton (St. Martin’s Press, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 13)
What it’s about: Stanton continues to offer up photos and stories of New Yorkers from his popular blog.
The buzz: It’s a sequel to the surprise 2013 best seller Humans of New York , which hit No. 5 on USA TODAY’s best-seller list.
5. My Journey by Donna Karan (Ballantine, non-fiction, on sale Oct. 13)
What it’s about: The designer fashions the story of her life.
The buzz: Features a foreword by Karan pal Barbra Streisand.
